events.name: Ethereum Singapore: Vitalik Buterin Presents Smart Contract Writing on Ethereum
events.description: The Ethereum Foundation, together with Ethereum Singapore, are happy to introduce a new Meetup format with this first in a series of lectures on how to author smart contracts on Ethereum, brought to you by Vitalik himself as inventor of the protocol. Join us at 5pm sharp on Tuesday 30 August at NUS Enterprise, second floor, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, for a masterclass that is meant to move away from opinionated panel discussions to go back to school and drill into the code itself. Come learn more about Smart Contract writing and the mechanics of the dynamic Ethereum Virtual Machine from the founder himself. We look forward to seeing you there! RSVP required and please show up for the event as the capacity will be strictly limited to ensure a conducive learning environment. Event Organizers and Supporters:    Venue sponsored by - NUS Enterprise  Food and drinks sponsored by:
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Pre IRAS Hackathon 2016
events.description: UP Singapore is proud to announce the first ever IRAS Hackathon! In line with a nation-wide strategy to provide public services with a citizen-centric approach, IRAS would like to explore how to provide best-in-class tax experiences to Singapore’s taxpayers, using intuitive digital services. At the IRAS Hackathon, you will have the opportunity to work alongside tax industry experts, fintech entrepreneurs, students, and passionate innovators, to co-create that help deliver taxpayer-centred experiences to Singapore’s SMEs, the self-employed, and individual taxpayers. Learn more about the theme and opportunity areas of this hackathon at our Theme page here: http://bit.ly/iras-theme or join us at our Pre-hackathon Workshop (30 August), where IRAS representatives and industry experts will discuss the theme in detail. Sign up now! http://bit.ly/2bkEq6X At the IRAS hackathon, you will have the chance to create and pitch your idea to a senior and distinguished panel of judges. Also, the winning team in both the Startup and Open Categories, will take home a cash prize of $3,000! Sign up now! http://bit.ly/2aXJMHg Learn more about the IRAS Hackathon 2016 here: http://bit.ly/iras-hackathon-2016.
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium , One Marina Boulevard, Level 21, Singapore

events.name: "Hands on your laptop" night! Spring Boot, JHipster and Testing
events.description: Hi, you might remember that we had organised a "hands-on night" last year. By popular demand, we're doing it again! You'll have 3 workshops to choose from (Spring Boot, JHipster, TDD).  You will need to bring a laptop so you can do the labs. Spring BootDapeng Liu is a Senior Instructor at Pivotal and has been using Spring Boot since the very beginning. Dapeng will teach you how to work with Spring Boot in a sample application and (more importantly!) will demystify all the magic behind Spring Boot's conventions over configuration. JHipsterSendil Kumar works at TCS and is part of the core JHipster team of contributors. He has been deeply involved in JHipster's migration to Angular 2.  Sendil will teach you how to generate a JHipster application.  Testing frameworksAlan Menant is a Senior Consultant at Zenika Singapore. He has presented at our User Group on Test Driven Development together with Han Lim back in July.Alan will teach you how to use Mockito and the Spring TestContext framework. We look forward to seeing you there!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Talk.CSS #9
events.description: This time, we're at Pivotal! Come join the CSS nerd out :D Latest CSS news by Talk.CSS Our new regular segment which will cover latest updates in the realm of CSS and HTML. Repokémon by Lim Chee Aun Showcase of GitHub repos with Pokémon names.  How did they do that? New York Times with Weiman Kow Open analysis of a NYT infographic and article.  If you want to do a lightning talk, please let us know before the event starts. We're more than happy to slot you in. CSS-related topics at ANY level are welcome because we're all here to learn and share. :) =========================================== General info We try to keep our timing tight so make sure you arrive close to the start time. Use the hash tag #SingaporeCSS whenever the urge comes.  Even if you're not a speaker this time, and get a sudden flash of inspiration, we welcome lightning talks too. Just poke us before the event starts and we'll slot you in. Lastly, if you want to speak or help out with anything, please contact Hui Jing or Chris.

events.name: Book Club: Algorithms on Strings – Week 4
events.description: Algorithms on Strings on Coursera   Come and learn with a group of us working through this online course together. This Week: Algorithmic Challenges 2 (Week 4) * Finish Assignment 3: Algorithmic Challenges Description World and internet is full of textual information. We search for information using textual queries, we read websites, books, e-mails. All those are strings from the point of view of computer science. To make sense of all that information and make search efficient, search engines use many string algorithms. Moreover, the emerging field of personalized medicine uses many search algorithms to find disease-causing mutations in the human genome. See https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-strings for more info on this course. Coursera offers a free "auditor" option and a paid option, if you want a certificate at the end. How to Participate 1. Watch the lectures and start the week's assignments.2. Find something in the week's content you found interesting and maybe research it a little more.3. At the meetup, we go around the room and each person gets a chance to tell the group about the thing they found interesting or ask questions.4. Group discussion and friendly banter ensues! All are welcome – beginners, experts, students and professionals. Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore 437032 Doors open at 7:00, meetup starts at 7:20.Bring healthy snacks and drinks of your choice! Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS Bookclub Gitter channel: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions/bookclub <a href="https://www.coursera.org/learn/algorithms-on-graphs/home/week/2"></a>
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: Entrepreneurship + Tech Transforming the Legal Industry: An Expert Panel
events.description:
RSVP for free here: ga.co/2bBaAK6

Speakers:
Rajesh Sreenivasan (Equity Partner: Head, Technology Media and Telecoms, Rajah & Tann Asia)
Deepak Khemchandani (Co-founder, zhiANT)
Jacinta Kelly (Head of Research, zhiANT)
Zi Qian Chang (Co-founder , INTELLLEX)
Cherilyn Tan (CEO, Asia Law Network)

As the legal industry is transformed and redefined with the rise of artificial intelligence, self-regulating contracts and robust cloud technologies that are empowering an increasingly mobile workforce, our expert panel will take a look at the opportunities and challenges this presents. We aim to share industry and technology insights that will keep you ahead of the game, and proficiencies that will enable you to work smarter.

Learn from industry veterans, established and budding start-up entrepreneurs, and forward-thinking lawyers that are taking on the challenge of changing the landscape of the legal industry.

Discussions will include:
- Entrepreneurship and the law (a segue into the skills required for new law graduates to stay ahead)
- New and emerging trends in the legal sector: The NewLaw firm vs the Traditional firm service model and its entwined relationship with cloud technology (touching on recent updates by the Monetary Authority of Singapore to the outsourcing guidelines, particularly in cloud computing)
- The significance of blockchain (smart contracts) in today's legal framework: a helicopter view on the implications of blockchain technology and the law

Join us for an informative evening to get inspired, socialise  and build your network with Singapore’s legal and technology community!

This session is moderated by Dr Jacinta Kelly.
events.location: IDA Labs @ #03-04, 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, , Singapore
